Title: Learning Operations Specialist
RoleDescription:
At Lyft, our purpose is to serve and connect. We aim to achieve this by cultivating a work environment where all team members belong and have the opportunity to thrive.
Lyft connects people to transportation to change the way we live and get around our communities. The Learning Operations Specialist plays a pivotal role in ensuring seamless training operations and data-driven performance insights by collaborating closely with all facets of the Safety and Customer Cares (SCC) team and assisting fellow members of the Learning & Performance team. This position reports directly to the Learning & Performance Manager. We are seeking an ideal candidate who is exceptionally detail-oriented, well-organized, process-driven, and enthusiastic about optimizing learning operations and analytics.
Responsibilities:

Learning Management System (LMS) Administration:

Serve as the primary administrator for the LMS, overseeing day-to-day operations and ensuring optimal user experience.
Upload, configure, and maintain eLearning content including knowledge checks, training packages, and accessible formats.
Maintain and manage Docebo groups and SCC catalogs, ensuring accuracy and alignment with Workday; act as main point of contact for LMS vendors and related stakeholders.
Collect LMS feedback via surveys, interviews, and stakeholder consultations to guide improvements.
Troubleshoot and resolve LMS-related issues, partnering with internal teams and vendors; manage Jira tickets as needed.
Audit and maintain the organization of existing courses in the LMS to assess relevance, accuracy, and usability.
Champion best practices in LMS usage and ensure the platform is fully leveraged.




Program Analysis & Performance Tracking:

Generate and distribute completion reports, develop tracking processes and guidelines to drive 100% training compliance across all lines of business.
Maintain training scorecard form, set expectations, and monitor team performance, sharing data with teams and leadership.
Analyze learner feedback (e.g., trainer and course surveys) to evaluate satisfaction and present insights to stakeholders regularly.
Evaluate training programs and curricula for effectiveness, ROI, and areas for improvement (e.g., Victim Assistance Training, Trainer Certification Program, compliance learning plans, onboarding, etc.).
Develop processes to understand the return of investment in all learning solutions; work with LP team members to establish innovative solutions and recommendations based on findings.
Manage and enhance learning dashboards such as the Onboarding Monitoring and Learning Effectiveness Score dashboards.
Analyze completion rates, knowledge check data, and performance behaviors to surface trends and performance opportunities.
Partner with stakeholders to connect learning outcomes to broader KPIs (e.g., quality scores, customer satisfaction).




Training Operations & Coordination:

Organize and manage logistics for both on-site and virtual training sessions in our Safety and Customer Care organization.
Collaborate closely with the Workforce Management team to schedule training sessions efficiently.
Write and deliver training announcements to appropriate teams that include all necessary training materials, instructions on how to complete, and clear completion expectations.
Execute various administrative tasks including gathering data and updating trainer scorecards and verifying vendor site reports.
Lead daily team meetings, sprint planning and retrospective meetings aligning on project outcomes and attempting to unblock team members.
Review learning solutions and assist in necessary edits for continuous improvement.
Own the development, implementation, and continuous improvement conversations related to internal team processes, tracking, documentation, and brainstorming innovative ways to improve and increase efficiency.
Assist the team to track milestones and task completion, ensuring the successful completion of all learning solutions from start to finish.
Maintain and update the LP team's playbook and the vendor trainer's playbook.
Help foster a positive and nurturing environment; responsible for planning team onsite meetings, outings and creating engaging team bonding activities.
Assist Facilitator and Designer in training development and facilitation.



Experience:

Proficiency in Excel including advanced functions (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, data analysis tools) for report generation and data manipulation
Knowledge of statistical analysis concepts and ability to identify trends, correlations, and performance patterns in learning data
Experience interpreting learning management system reports and translating data into actionable insights
Strong analytical mindset with ability to ask the right questions and dig deeper into data anomalies
Experience presenting data findings to various stakeholder levels, from individual contributors to senior leadership
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable recommendations for non-technical audiences
Critical thinking skills to evaluate data quality, identify gaps, and recommend process improvements

Excellent written and oral communication skills.

Title: Director, Design Foundations
RoleDescription:
At Lyft, our mission is to connect our customers to the people, places, and moments that matter most to them. 
Lyft is seeking a Director, Design Foundations to oversee our three core central design functions: design systems, content design, and design operations. Design Foundations, as a central team, is responsible for defining the patterns of our UI and interaction language, product voice and tone, and design program management that all of our teams across Lyft rely on to build the end user features that define the Lyft experience and brand. The leader were looking for will lead this central team to deliver a consistent, accessible, and branded experience for all of our customers. They will provide technical and creative direction to guide their teams output as well as work closely with cross-organizational partners to shape the future of transportation as experienced through our products. 
This leader will also chair the Design Functional Excellence council at Lyft, composed of senior design leaders across Lyft, with a mission to define quality and craft excellence for all design teams across the company. The functional excellence group will build the rituals and practices to deliver on these expectations, and will nurture a strong and supportive design community. 
99% of the Lyft experience takes place in the real world and its critical you know how to think beyond the pixel. As a qualified candidate, you bring deep experience building elegant, beloved products, a sharp eye for detail, and the vision to push boundaries and shape what comes next. You can inspire a team and drive action. You have experience leading teams designing for online and offline. Your work demonstrates customer obsession while delivering meaningful business impact.
You must be a proven design leader, an excellent communicator, a seasoned collaborator, and a cross-functional, cross-organizational team player that can thrive in a very fast-paced, dynamic working environment. You are comfortable working closely with passionate designers, product managers, engineers, scientists, marketers, and executives that care deeply about creating beautiful, high-impact products.
Were intent on changing the world by delivering exceptional products that make transportation easy, safe and joyful for everyone and we are excited to find the right design leader to join us on this journey.  
Responsibilities:

Own and shape the design system and design standards that define the Lyft product experience
Lead, mentor, and inspire a multi-disciplinary team of 30+ including systems-focused product designers, content designers, and program managers 
Push the boundaries of your teams execution. Foster creativity to explore divergent concepts and create a trajectory for the company
Provide technical and creative direction that supports and elevates the quality of the work and design system
Own and drive the design project lifecycle from strategic planning, scheduling, requirements gathering, design reviews, delivery and implementation to launch
Lead the team to define and deliver the step-change processes and tools that enable effective team workflows and collaboration
Partner closely with Marketing to bring the brand to life through the design system and content guidelines
Chair the cross-org Design Functional Excellence Council to drive design excellence broadly across Lyft, continuing to elevate our (already) strong design community within Lyft and a strong design reputation outside of Lyft 
Collaborate, communicate, and negotiate with other design leaders, product managers, engineers and stakeholders at all levels across the organization
Lead quarterly planning and prioritization with cross-functional teams, balancing multiple inputs and needs
Provide up to date visibility into current projects, team utilization, project health and priorities
Manage the resource allocation within Central Design and across partner teams
Build relationships with cross-functional team members and executives across organizations, and effectively speak to process, design goals, and team vision

Experience:

10+ years of applied product design management experience with a track record of delivering high-quality user experiences 
Technical understanding and execution of UX design and general design principles and best practices 
Experience leading and mentoring multi-disciplinary teams of design professionals
A passion for design, design process, and design management

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer, Map Data
RoleDescription:
At Lyft, our purpose is to serve and connect. We aim to achieve this by cultivating a work environment where all team members belong and have the opportunity to thrive.
Our transportation network serves millions daily, relying on a map that reflects the constantly changing real world. Our systems leverage insights from driving locations, sensor data, and user feedback to provide the best possible service. This empowers us to optimize routes, recommend ideal transport modes, ensure safe drop-off locations, and much more.
To strengthen our efforts, we are hiring a Senior ML Engineer who will work end-to-end on creating and improving new capabilities to detect changes in the environment and reflect them in our Lyft map using a wide variety of input sources from the Lyft fleet. For this we are looking for someone who values software engineering best practices, loves the algorithmic and geospatial side of the challenge and is data-driven from start to end. 
Our technology stack ranges from basic machine learning models to large language models and running them at scale on millions of images. You will work with incredibly passionate and talented colleagues from machine learning, data science, and engineering on projects that delight our passengers and drivers  powered by an up to date map. 
Responsibilities:

Design, develop, deploy, monitor, operate and maintain scalable, robust, stable, reliable and performant systems to support map data pipelines that operate on large data sets.
Provide technical leadership and direction to the team by defining the teams roadmap, architecture, processes, and best practices, with a focus on scalability and robustness in data pipeline design and implementation for large geospatial datasets.
Analyze our internal systems and processes, locate areas for improvement/automation, and build tools and dashboards to provide visibility.
Write clean, testable, and maintainable code while implementing best practices for code reviews, CI/CD pipelines, and system observability.
Help establish technical roadmaps and architectures based on technology and our business needs.
Drive high-impact projects and innovate new solutions to provide the best mapping experience possible.
Ship ML models at scale and low cost by focussing on systems / performance engineering.
Create resilient and scalable infrastructure that enables rapid iteration of new pipelines and  machine learning models.

Experience:

BS/MS or equivalent degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
5+ years of experience building machine learning algorithms at scale, deep learning and their tools and learning frameworks. 
Extensive experience with Python (including its data related batteries like numpy or pandas).
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS and/or GCP, including experience with cloud infrastructure.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills with experience working in cross-functional teams.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a passion for tackling complex challenges.
Proven track record of proactively driving initiatives, taking ownership of projects, and independently identifying and implementing improvements.
Advantageous would be:

Experience with MLOps processes
Familiarity with geospatial data processing, GIS frameworks, or mapping infrastructure
Familiarity with Go
